sections.paragraph: named form Adramys, brother of Croesus king of Lydia, a seaport in the province of Asia [[70]Asia], situated on a bay of the Aegean Sea, about 70 miles north of Smyrna, in the district anciently called Aeolis, and also Mysia. See (Acts 16:7) [[71]Mitylene] (Acts 27:2) The modern Adramyti is a poor village.
